function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Viral loads found in personal samplers worn by the sampling team when in the presence of a patient receiving oxygen via nasal cannula, indicating potential airborne transmission.","Impact":"Increased risk of airborne virus spread in healthcare environments.","Mitigation":"Use of advanced air filtration systems and personal protective equipment (PPE).","Technologies":"Advanced air filtration systems, HEPA filters, UV-C germicidal lamps.","People":"Healthcare workers, patients, visitors.","Owner":"Healthcare facilities, infection control departments."},{"Description":"Lack of direct confirmatory evidence of self-inoculation into mucous membranes as the end-stage pathway to infection through droplet and contact transmission routes.","Impact":"Uncertainty in understanding the modes of transmission of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Conducting rigorous studies to confirm the pathways of infection and transmission. Emphasizing the importance of hand hygiene and surface disinfection.","Technologies":"Advanced diagnostic sampling and sequencing technologies.","People":"Medical researchers, public health officials.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations."},{"Description":"Incongruity in the level of evidence required to demonstrate airborne transmission compared to other transmission modes.","Impact":"Challenges in establishing comprehensive measures to prevent airborne transmission of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Reviewing and updating guidelines and regulations to address the incongruity. Conducting further research to establish conclusive evidence of airborne transmission.","Technologies":"Particle counters, airflow visualization technologies.","People":"Epidemiologists, public health policymakers.","Owner":"Government health agencies, research institutions."}]}
